infos.info: The broadcast history is from Hickerson's book which is at variance from the information in Lackmann's book.

synopses.synopsis: In both runs, Curtain Time attempted to play the same sizable audience that had made The First Nighter Program a radio powerhouse. It had a theater setting, announcements that the curtain was 'about to go up,' and the same fare, generally bubbly boy-girl romances... - On the Air: The Encyclopedia of Old-Time Radio by John Dunning
